intro: Aralia chinensis var. albomarginata, commonly known as the white-margin aralia, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia. It features compound leaves with a distinctive white or cream-colored margin, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are followed by red berries. It thrives in partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a suitable ornamental plant in gardens. Its foliage and unique appearance make it a popular choice for shady garden spaces.
